responses.content:
```yaml
leads:
  - headline: The middleware that sets SRI hashes for dynamic pages unconditionally overwrites the CSP header set by the user.
    analysis: |
      The `getCSPMiddlewareHandler` function in `src/core.mjs` always calls `patchHeaders`, which will unconditionally set the `Content-Security-Policy` header in the response, even if the user has already set it in their own middleware.
    cwe: CWE-281
    function_names:
      - getCSPMiddlewareHandler
      - patchHeaders
    filenames:
      - src/core.mjs
    classification: slightly promising
```

leads.headline: The middleware that sets SRI hashes for dynamic pages unconditionally overwrites the CSP header set by the user.
leads.analysis: The getCSPMiddlewareHandler function in src/core.mjs always calls patchHeaders, which will unconditionally set the Content-Security-Policy header in the response, even if the user has already set it in their own middleware.
